content:
I have a BT email address, I also created some additional email addresses so members of family could use them.

I run two different versions of Thunderbird, the current ESR and also a BETA version. On ESR I have BT set up two of those email addresses as a Pop accounts and on Beta, one is set up as an Imap account.

Please confirm - is BT your Internet Service Provider? Is this an account because BT are ISP? OR is this a Business account etc ?

The email address and password used to access your main BT Account (where you see package details etc - not emails) must be the same email address and password as used for the main BT email address. Please confirm this is set up OK. All other alias email addresses etc can use their own separate password.

BT server settings have not changed. There is no special setup for Pop and Imap - both are auto enabled.

Q: Are you able to logon to BT webmail account via a browser? Q: Are you able to do this for all of your BT email addresses ?

Please confirm you can get webmail access to all 3 of your BT email addresses.

Q: Have you set up to use 2FA or not? It might be relevant or not, but it's not required to access via pop or imap.

Then post the following information:

  • In Thunderbird
  • Help > Troubleshooting Information
  • Scroll down to 'Mail and News Accounts'
  • Copy all the data in that section and paste it into this forum question OR upload an image showing all data in that section.
creator: Toad-Hall

content: Dovrebbe darteli TIM non questo forum. Quelli pubblicati sul sito TIM li trovi qui comunque: https://www.tim.it/assistenza/assistenza-tecnica/mail/tin-it (e li avresti trovati da solo con un qualsiasi motore di ricerca)
creator: @next

content:
Servers from self-hosted accounts tend to be more restrictive than others, at least from my personal experience. Here is my suggestion:

  1. - click file>offline>download for the first account. This is to ensure that you have 100% of the headers and content downloaded.
  2. - now, COPY the inbox to Local folders, either by exiting thunderbird and copying with windows file explorer or by using the importexporttools addon (highlight Local Folders, rightclick and select the import mbox option and then locate and select the other account's inbox file. This copies the messages to your local folders.
  3. - now, create a manually-run filter to upload to the other account.

My intent in this suggestion is to minimize activity that may be overloading the hostinger server.
creator: davidsk

content:
bdstanley said
Why does using the delete key on a highlighted message only create a strike through not an actual delete

Because you account setting are to mark deleted mail as such, not move it to a trash or deleted fold or delete it as such. Marked messages usually disappear after Thunderbird restarts and the expunge command it issued to the server for marked messages at shutdown (also in your account settings).
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
Dubito che il timeout c'entri qualcosa. Se gli account Gmail sono in IMAP, probabilmente è Google che limita la procedura dato che accedi simultaneamente ad entrambi gli account, attività che potrebbe essere considerata anomala. Salvando il file eml invece il caricamento avviene da locale e solo uno dei due account viene utilizzato.

Dovresti chiedere a Google. Per quanto ne so non ci sono impostazioni particolari da settare, è quasi sempre il server che blocca il trasferimento.
creator: @next

content: Thank you for your response. I checked and Google does not block the transfer nor are there any problems with quotas (I am Google Wokspace Administrator). From Google support, they confirm to me that there are no blocks and the operation should go smoothly. They suggest that I contact Thunderbird support. Since transferring messages from one account to another goes smoothly when they have no attachment or when the attachment is less than 5MB in size, I wonder if there is some setting that limits this activity in Thunderbird.

content: Please do a screenshot of the account folder. Here is how to get there: - click help>troubleshootinginformation - scroll down to 'profile folder' and click 'open folder' - click the imapmail folder and then click the account folder - you should now be in the folder with message folders, such as inbox, sent, etc. - do a screenshot of this and post it. That should provide information on what is using the storage. Thank you.
creator: davidsk

content: Like you, I also use eternal-september, and sometimes find it difficult to access. Two days ago, I couldn't get it to work at all for a few hours. Then, suddenly everything worked. My setting is port 119 and no security, although other settings may work. The fact that you sometimes must unsubscribe and resubscribe points to some inconsistency. I just checked my own account and it is working. I wish I had some particular advice to share, but I do not.
creator: davidsk

content:
Thank you for your reply!

I'm using port 563 with SSL/TLS and that normally works. I have no idea if this could be a factor in the trouble I'm having today.

I think you *did* give me some advice: wait a few hours and see if the problem clears on its own (i.e. after Eternal September fixes whatever is wrong at their end). :-)

In the meantime, I remember someone posting to my newsgroup recently that there are some web-based interfaces to Usenet that I'd never heard of before. I don't know if they are new or have been around a while. Do you know where I can find these?
creator: frank-lee-speeking

content: Ok, I'm not guru on usenet, having spent most of my usenet hours with the xnews app. Google used to support usenet, but no longer.There are a few web-based providers listed at https://www.newsgroupreviews.com/web-usenet.html - but there is a monthly fee. You might try changing configuration to port 119 with no security to see if that works more reliably.
creator: davidsk

content:
Unfortunately, changing the settings to port 119 and no security has made no difference at all. I don't even get a newgroup list when I try to "Manage subscriptions".

Could I have broken something when I deleted the Thunderbird newsgroup? I realized a moment it was too late that I had right-clicked on the newsgroup and then chosen "Delete" rather than "Unsubscribe" so I wonder if that deleted some critical part of the underlying file structure and *that* is why I no longer get even newsgroup lists?

The good news is that I was able to subscribe to Newsgrouper, a free web interface to Usenet and it seems to work okay. I've used it to post to my newsgroup and asked if anyone else was having trouble with Eternal September. No replies yet....

In case anyone else sees this, all you have to do to use this service is go to newsgrouper.org, click on the Register button, then click on their email address (newsgrouper@yahoo.com) and write a short email asking them to register you for the service. Within a couple of hours, they send you a password. Then just go to newsgrouper.org again, fill in the email address you used to register and the password they gave you and click on "Login". That takes you to a page that lets you search for the newsgroup you want; once you've clicked on the newsgroup, you can read and post to the newsgroup.
creator: frank-lee-speeking

content: At a high level, my inference is that you want to switch from POP to IMAP. Assuming that to be true, you need to create a new account setup for the same account but in IMAP. Do not attempt to just change the POP to IMAP as that just makes huge errors. Then, if the other computers are also set for IMAP, they will all be able to access the messages.
creator: davidsk

content: Settings/General/Incoming Mails, choose TB notifications or system notifications, but not both.
